conbody.p: Sub-classes are more specialized versions of a class, which inherit properties from their parent class, and can introduce their own. For example, the class Instrument might have sub-classes called Stock, Bond and Index. Microsoft Corporation stock, MSFT, would be an instance of the Stock sub-class. If the Instrument class defines a property called rate, then each of its sub-classes (Stock, Bond, and Index) will inherit this member.

Sub-classes can add new members. The Index sub-class can add a property called indexComposition. The SMI object would have the indexComposition property, but MSFT would not because it is a Stock, not an Index. In fact, inheritance is an is a relationship. (For example, MSFT is a Stock, and a Stock is an Instrument. Thus, MSFT inherits the properties of both Stock and Instrument.)
